sen.j: 伊勢 貞国（いせ さだくに、応永5年（1398年）- 享徳3年（1454年））は、室町時代の幕府政所執事。
sen.e: Sadakuni ISE (1398-1454) was a steward of the Bakufu Mandokoro in the Muromachi period.
Sadakuni ISE (1398-1454) was a steward of the Bakufu Mandokoro in the Muromachi period.
Sadakuni ISE (1398 - 1454) was a steward of the Bakufu Mandokoro in the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 父は伊勢貞行といわれる（伊勢貞経ともいわれる）。
sen.e: It is said that his father was Sadayuki ISE (it is also said Sadatsune ISE).
It is said that his father was Sadayuki ISE (it is also said Sadatsune ISE).
It is said that his father was Sadayuki ISE (it is also said Sadatsune ISE).

sen.j: 伊勢貞経の養嗣子、母は信州木曾の娘。
sen.e: He was the adopted heir of Sadatsune ISE, and his mother was the daughter of Kiso SHINSHU.
sen.cmt: 読み方不明ですが下記のように訳出しています。信州木曾→Kiso SHINSHU
sen.e: He was the adopted heir of Sadatsune ISE, and his mother was the daughter of Kiso SHINSHU.
He was the adopted heir of Sadatsune ISE, and his mother was the daughter of Kiso SHINSHU.

sen.j: 子に伊勢貞親、伊勢貞藤。
sen.e: Sadachika ISE and Sadafuji ISE were his children.
Sadachika ISE and Sadafuji ISE were his children.
Sadachika ISE and Sadafuji ISE were his children.

sen.j: 伊勢貞国の娘は北条早雲と北川殿（今川義忠室）の母。
sen.e: Soun HOJO and the mother of Kitagawa-Dono (a wife of Yoshitada IMAGAWA) were Sadakuni ISE's daughters.
Soun HOJO and the mother of Kitagawa-Dono (a wife of Yoshitada IMAGAWA) were Sadakuni ISE's daughters.
Sadakuni ISE's daughter was the mother of Soun HOJO and Kitagawa-Dono (wife of Yoshitada IMAGAWA).
sen.cmt: 意味がおかしいので書き直しました。

sen.j: 室町幕府将軍の足利義教・足利義勝・足利義政の3代に仕える。
sen.e: He served Shogun of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) for three generations; Yoshinori ASHIKAGA, Yoshikatsu ASHIKAGA, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA.
He served Shogun of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) for three generations; Yoshinori ASHIKAGA, Yoshikatsu ASHIKAGA, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA.
He served Shogun of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) for three generations; Yoshinori ASHIKAGA, Yoshikatsu ASHIKAGA, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: 1410年（応永17年）から1449年（宝徳元年）まで政所執事を務めた。
sen.e: He served as Mandokoro Shitsuji (chief of Mandokoro, the Administrative Board) from 1410 to 1449.
He served as Mandokoro Shitsuji (chief of Mandokoro, the Administrative Board) from 1410 to 1449.
He served as Mandokoro Shitsuji (chief of Mandokoro, the Administrative Board) from 1410 to 1449.
In 1454, he passed away.
In 1454, he passed away.
In 1454, he passed away.
